summary: About 20 Chinese humanoid robot companies debuted at CES 2026 in Las Vegas, significantly outnumbering competitors from the US, Japan, and Europe combined, showcasing advancements in hardware manufacturing and cost efficiency. The firms are targeting overseas markets through direct-to-consumer models while facing challenges including high shipping costs, complex supply chains, and different consumer expectations between Chinese and American markets.

The program also supports the ICRA WBCD 2026 dual-arm robot competition.

The new products target various lawn sizes and terrain complexity levels with autonomous mapping and deployment features.

The toolkit enables hearing, vision, thinking, and physical world interaction capabilities for applications in AI glasses, learning robots, companion toys, and intelligent robots.

The company's digital human avatars are deployed across livestreaming, customer service, travel, brand endorsement, esports commentary, and entertainment with 50,000+ active brand partnerships.

The company develops wide-bandgap semiconductor and advanced power conversion technology for new energy vehicles, targeting battery thermal management, autonomous suspension, motor control, and ultra-fast charging applications.

title: Google and Character.AI negotiate first major settlements in teen chatbot death cases
summary: Google and Character.AI, a 2021 startup providing AI chatbot companions that merged with Google for $2.7 billion in 2024, are settling lawsuits from families whose teenagers died by suicide after interacting with the platform's chatbots.

The Seoul-based cybersecurity firm will expand its zero-trust architecture and multi-factor authentication offerings globally while participating in FIDO Alliance standards development to drive digital identity adoption.

The facility targets high-performance computing demands from AI model training and inference applications.

The 100-billion-parameter model targets finance, manufacturing, and healthcare industries requiring high trust and explainability.

summary: Artinus launched AI-powered curation tools allowing art collectors and curators to gain personalized insights through expert analysis and semantic understanding of artworks, complementing its rebranded homepage redesign at CES 2026. The Korean art platform's deep learning technology helps users build collections confidently by analyzing visual elements and artistic context.

The approach combines ontology, knowledge graphs, and probabilistic reasoning to identify security vulnerabilities in complex systems.

summary: Samsung Electronics showcased 15 C-Lab startups at CES 2026, including robotics firm RONIK and pet healthcare AI service Sevenriter, demonstrating Samsung's strategy to nurture innovative companies in AI, IoT, and digital health sectors for global market expansion. The initiatives highlight Samsung's broader commitment to supporting next-generation technology entrepreneurs.

summary: Alphabet's AI subsidiary DeepMind's AlphaGo surpassed Apple's market capitalization for the first time since 2019, reaching $370.8 billion as the stock gained over 2% on January 7th. AlphaGo's 2025 success in AI business ventures, which drove a 65% stock surge, represents the strongest performance since the 2009 financial crisis, positioning the company ahead of Apple despite recent AI competition concerns.

title: GLMìœ¼ë¡œ ìœ ëª…í•œ ì¤‘êµ­ì˜ Z.ai, IPO ì§„í–‰ $560M ì´ìƒì˜ ê°€ì¹˜
summary: Z.ai, a Chinese AI company known for developing GLM language models, is preparing for an initial public offering at a valuation exceeding $560 million. The company aims to capitalize on growing demand for domestically developed AI models in China's competitive AI market.

summary: Razer unveiled the ZERO Air gaming laptop at CES 2026, weighing just 1.58 kg while delivering 160W dual-channel performance using Intel Panther Lake mobile processors and Nvidia GeForce RTX 50 GPUs. The laptop combines portability with high performance through advanced heat dissipation and features a 15.3-inch OLED screen, solving the long-standing trade-off between gaming performance and device weight.

summary: RoboSense and Segway announced autonomous delivery robot 'XiaoGe' at CES 2026, powered by RoboSense's proprietary hand-eye coordination technology combining 3D point cloud data with tactile sensing. The robot can autonomously complete over 20 complex operational steps including packaging, uploading, transporting, unboxing, and delivery without human intervention.

title: AI Drugmaker Insilico Strikes $888 Million Cancer Drug Deal With Servier
summary: Insilico Medicine, an AI-driven drug discovery firm, signed a collaboration deal worth up to $888 million with French pharmaceutical company Servier for cancer drug development. The landmark deal demonstrates major investor confidence in AI-powered drug discovery shortly after Insilico's Hong Kong Stock Exchange IPO.

title: Swap raises $100M from DST, ICONIQ to unify fragmented global e-commerce ops
summary: Swap, an AI-powered e-commerce operating system that unifies returns, shipping, taxes, and payments, raised $100 million in Series C funding co-led by DST Global and ICONIQ at an undisclosed valuation. The platform helps mid-sized brands ($5M-$100M revenue) increase cash retention by 12% and boost sales 111% year-over-year through AI-driven demand prediction and automation.

title: Unicorn alert: LMArena zips $150M at $1.7B valuation to make users the judge of AI performance
summary: LMArena, a San Francisco-based AI benchmark platform that crowdsources model evaluations through user comparisons, raised $150 million at a $1.7 billion valuation led by Felicis and UC Investments. The platform's commercial AI Evaluations service reached a $30 million annualized consumption rate within four months of launch.

title: Boston Dynamics Unveils Humanoid Robot Atlas at CES
summary: Boston Dynamics unveiled an updated humanoid robot Atlas at CES and announced a partnership with Google DeepMind to enhance the robot's cognitive capabilities through AI integration.

title: Mobileye to Acquire Mentee Robotics in $900M Deal
summary: Mobileye acquired Mentee Robotics for $900 million to accelerate development of physical AI systems for autonomous driving and humanoid robotics applications.

title: OpenAI unveils ChatGPT Health, says 230 million users ask about health each week
summary: OpenAI launched ChatGPT Health, a dedicated space where 230 million weekly users can discuss health and wellness topics with integration to Apple Health and other wellness apps. The feature won't train OpenAI's models and rolls out in coming weeks.

title: Where VCs think AI startups can win, even with OpenAI in the game
summary: Venture capitalists believe 2026 will be the breakthrough year for consumer AI, with opportunities for startups in niche applications despite competition from larger AI platforms like ChatGPT and Meta AI.

title: Anthropic reportedly raising $10B at $350B valuation
summary: Anthropic, the Claude AI maker, is raising $10 billion at a $350 billion valuation from Coatue Management and Singapore's GIC, nearly doubling its value from a $183 billion valuation three months prior. The funding is separate from a $15 billion commitment from Nvidia and Microsoft.

title: Skylight debuts Calendar 2 to keep your family organized
summary: Skylight, a bootstrapped company with 1.3 million family users, debuted Calendar 2, a mid-sized digital calendar device using AI to consolidate family schedules, manage grocery lists, plan meals, and digitize paper-based event notifications from schools.

title: Caterpillar taps Nvidia to bring AI to itsÂ construction equipment
summary: Caterpillar partnered with Nvidia to pilot Cat AI, an AI assistant system on its Cat 306 CR Mini Excavator using Nvidia's Jetson Thor platform to help operators access resources, receive safety tips, and schedule services.

title: Intel spinout Articul8 raises more than half of $70M round at $500M valuation
summary: Intel spinout Articul8 secured over $35 million of a planned $70 million Series B at a $500 million valuation, targeting regulated industries with on-premise AI systems for energy, manufacturing, aerospace, and financial services with $90 million in total contract value from 29 customers.

title: Exclusive: Nitro Commerce Raises $5 Mn To Scale International Operations
summary: Delhi NCR-based Nitro Commerce, an AI-powered marketing platform for direct-to-consumer brands using intent-based targeting, raised $5 million Series A led by Cornerstone Ventures to scale international operations and reach $10 million ARR from current $5 million.

title: Infosys to Deploy Cognitionâ€™s AI Software Engineer Devin for Enterprises
summary: Infosys partnered with Cognition to deploy Devin, an AI software engineer, across its internal operations and client engagements globally, integrating it with Infosys Topaz Fabric to automate development workflows. The collaboration targets software development acceleration and engineering productivity improvements, with initial deployments in financial services including banking, payments, and capital markets.

title: Keysight Rolls Out Software to Validate Safety-Critical AI
summary: Keysight Technologies launched AI Software Integrity Builder, a validation solution for AI-enabled systems in safety-critical environments like autonomous vehicles, addressing regulatory compliance with standards such as ISO/PAS 8800 and the EU AI Act. The software analyzes data quality, explains model decisions, and tests inference behavior to ensure safe deployment of AI systems.

title: Infosys, AWS Partner to Speed Up Enterprise Use of Generative AI
summary: Infosys and Amazon Web Services partnered to integrate Infosys Topaz with Amazon Q Developer, enabling enterprises to enhance software development, HR, recruitment, and vendor management through generative AI. The collaboration targets manufacturing, telecom, financial services, and consumer goods sectors globally with automated documentation and code generation capabilities.

title: NXP, GE HealthCare Partner to Advance Edge AI for Acute Care at CES 2026
summary: NXP Semiconductors and GE HealthCare partnered to develop edge AI solutions for acute care, unveiling voice-enabled anesthesia delivery systems and intelligent neonatal monitoring concepts at CES 2026. Both systems process data locally on-device using NXP's neural processing units to ensure privacy and real-time performance in operating rooms and neonatal intensive care units.

title: Red Sea Global, Bunat VC launch Saudi-focused AI venture fund
summary: Red Sea Global and Bunat Ventures launched a Saudi-focused AI venture fund targeting 25 early- and growth-stage AI-native startups over three years, providing capital and access to real-world testing infrastructure at tourism destinations The Red Sea and AMAALA. The initiative aims to support Saudi entrepreneurs and Saudi-founded global companies expanding into the Kingdom while strengthening the local AI ecosystem.

title: Aamar raises $4 million+ seed round to modernise Saudi rental market
summary: Saudi proptech startup Aamar raised over $4 million in seed funding to expand its AI-powered platform that automates leasing and asset-finance operations. The company has already served 10,000+ customers and facilitated rental transactions worth SAR 150 million, with plans to scale geographically across Saudi Arabia.

title: Introducing Lenovo and Motorola Qira, a Personal Ambient Intelligence Designed to Work Across Devices
summary: Lenovo unveiled Qira, a cross-device ambient intelligence system that integrates at the system level across PCs, tablets, smartphones, and wearables to provide context-aware assistance without requiring users to invoke a separate app. Unlike traditional chatbots, Qira learns user intent over time and orchestrates actions across devices offline, with Motorola launching its own Qira variant.

title: Nous Research's NousCoder-14B is an open-source coding model landing right in the Claude Code moment
summary: Nous Research released NousCoder-14B, an open-source AI coding model trained in four days on 48 NVIDIA B200 GPUs, achieving 67.87% accuracy on competitive programming benchmarks. The company published complete training infrastructure and model weights, enabling reproducibility as the open-source community competes with proprietary coding assistants like Anthropic's Claude Code.

title: TII Abu-Dhabi Released Falcon H1R-7B: A New Reasoning Model Outperforming Others in Math and Coding with only 7B Params with 256k Context Window
summary: Technology Innovation Institute (TII) Abu Dhabi released Falcon-H1R-7B, a 7-billion-parameter AI reasoning model that matches 14B-47B models in math and coding tasks while maintaining efficiency with a 256k-token context window. The model combines hybrid Transformer and Mamba2 architecture with supervised fine-tuning and reinforcement learning to optimize reasoning performance.

title: Nvidia at CES 2026: Rubin platform, Vera CPU, GR00T robots, and Alpamayo L4 autonomy
summary: Nvidia unveiled its Rubin platform at CES 2026, featuring integrated Vera CPUs, Rubin GPUs, and networking components designed for large-scale AI workloads with up to 10x lower inference costs than its Blackwell architecture. The company also introduced deskside AI supercomputers (DGX Spark and DGX Station) and a context memory storage solution for handling long-context multi-agent AI models.

title: xAI nears $230B valuation in $20B Nvidia-led raise to challenge OpenAI, Anthropic
summary: Elon Musk's xAI raised $20 billion from investors including Nvidia, Fidelity, and Qatar Investment Authority, reaching a valuation exceeding $230 billion just two years after its 2023 founding. The funding will expand xAI's data center infrastructure to support training of its Grok AI models and compete with OpenAI and Anthropic.

title: Tailwind ì œì‘ì‚¬, ì—”ì§€ë‹ˆì–´ë§ íŒ€ì˜ 75% í•´ê³
summary: Tailwind CSS creator Tailwind Labs laid off 75% of its engineering team, about 8 people, as part of a strategic shift toward AI optimization. The company added an /llms.txt endpoint to its documentation to help large language models learn its framework more efficiently.

title: Alexa+ comes for ChatGPT's web turf
summary: Amazon launched Alexa.com, a web-based interface bringing its AI-powered Alexa+ assistant to compete with ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude for the first time beyond devices. The assistant includes agentic capabilities with integrations from Expedia, Yelp, and Square, with user engagement surging 3-5x since Alexa+ rollout.

summary: Qualcomm's China division executive highlighted at CES 2026 that edge-side AI and physics-informed AI are becoming critical technology breakthroughs, with emphasis on deploying AI at device level for real-time applications in vehicles, wearables, and robotics. The company projects that cloud, edge, and device-level AI will operate collaboratively, with hybrid AI becoming the mainstream model for future development.

title: æ™ºå…ƒå‘å¸ƒå¼€æºä»¿çœŸå¹³å°Genie Sim 3.0
summary: ZhiYuan Robotics launched Genie Sim 3.0, the first large language model-driven open-source simulation platform based on NVIDIA Isaac Sim, at CES 2026. The platform combines 3D reconstruction and visual generation to create digital twin environments at scale, featuring 10,000+ hours of real robot operation data and an evaluation system covering over 100,000 scenarios.

summary: Zhizhu AI, a Beijing-based AI company, established a new subsidiary in Xiamen, China, Zhizhu Huazhang Technology, with registered capital of 5 million yuan. The subsidiary operates in AI application software development, AI algorithms, and foundational AI software development.

summary: Kunlun Chip, Baidu's AI semiconductor subsidiary, plans to raise up to $2 billion through a Hong Kong IPO with lead underwriters including China International Capital Corporation and China Securities. The company designs AI chips for data center and computing applications.

title: Googleâ€™s Koray Kavukcuoglu: Turning abstract AI thinking into user-friendly products
summary: Google's Chief AI Architect Koray Kavukcuoglu discusses Gemini 3, the company's latest large language model launched in November, which can create interactive apps and widgets from user queries. The model impressed rivals, prompting OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to declare a 'code red' to improve ChatGPT's capabilities to compete with Google.

title: ë°”ë””í”„ëœë“œ, CES 2026ì„œ 'AI í—¬ìŠ¤ì¼€ì–´ë¡œë´‡' ê¸€ë¡œë²Œ ì‹œì¥ ê³µëµ
summary: Korean healthcare robotics company Bodyband showcased 21 new AI wellness robot products at CES 2026, including its flagship Wearbale AI healthcare robot 733 with robotics technology that uses computer vision to analyze body movement for personalized care recommendations.

title: BMWÂ·í…ŒìŠ¬ë¼ ê¸´ì¥í•  íœ´ë¨¸ë…¸ì´ë“œ ë“±ì¥â€¦í˜„ëŒ€ì°¨, ì°¨ì„¸ëŒ€ ë¡œë´‡ ê³µê°œ
summary: Hyundai Motor Group revealed next-generation AI humanoid robots at CES 2026, including new Atlas models and autonomous robots powered by Boston Dynamics' Orbit AI, designed for industrial and manufacturing applications across diverse environments.

title: 'ì•ŒíŒŒë§ˆìš”' ë‚´ë†“ì€ ì—”ë¹„ë””ì•„, ì„±ì¥ì„¸ ê³„ì† ì´ì–´ì§ˆê¹Œ
summary: Nvidia faces potential slowdown in its growth trajectory despite showcasing its next-generation Vera Rubin AI GPU platform and Alphamayo autonomous driving model at CES 2026, as analysts debate whether the company's rapid expansion can sustain amid data center investment concerns.

title: í—¬ë¦¬ì˜¤ìŠ¤, CESì—ì„œ ìŒì„± í†µí•œ AI ê±´ê°•ê´€ë¦¬ì™€ ë¹›ì„ í™œìš©í•œ í—¬ìŠ¤ì¼€ì–´ ê¸°ìˆ  ì„ ë³´ì—¬
summary: Korean health tech company Helios unveiled Heliostar, an AI-powered home healthcare device using light therapy and voice control for cardiac health monitoring and personalized wellness management, available for domestic certification in the first half of 2026.

title: ì„¸ë¼ì ¬, CES 2026ì„œ 'AI ì›°ë‹ˆìŠ¤ í™ˆ' ê³µê°œ
summary: Korean wellness platform Seracell introduced AI Wellness Home at CES 2026, an integrated home healthcare system using AI to deliver personalized care across aging, lifestyle management, and health monitoring through coordinated smart devices and services.

title: NVIDIA AI Released Nemotron Speech ASR: A New Open Source Transcription Model Designed from the Ground Up for Low-Latency Use Cases like Voice Agents
summary: Nvidia released Nemotron Speech ASR, a 600-million-parameter open-source transcription model optimized for low-latency voice agents and live captioning, achieving sub-8% word error rates while maintaining predictable latency for real-time applications.

title: AMD Competes With Intel With New AI Chips
summary: AMD is competing with Intel by launching new AI chips, though the semiconductor vendor still needs to achieve greater adoption by PC manufacturers.

title: How S&P Global built a multimodel AI platform
summary: S&P Global partnered with Google Cloud in December 2025 to adopt a multimodel AI approach using Vertex AI platform, enabling the financial services company to access Google Gemini and third-party models to enhance client services.

title: CES 2026 opens with AI stepping into physical world
summary: At CES 2026 in Las Vegas, over 4,500 companies showcased AI transitioning from software to physical embodiment, with Samsung and LG competing to become everyday AI companions through connected devices and robots. Samsung aims to embed AI across 400 million devices annually, while LG demonstrated its autonomous home robot CLOiD powered by affectionate intelligence.

title: SK AX wins government approval for AI skills certification
summary: South Korean company SK AX won government accreditation for its AI Competency Certification Platform under Korea's Corporate Qualification Program, validating the generative AI-focused system used by 3,800 SK Group employees. The platform assesses real-world job performance through AI-powered lifecycle processes rather than theoretical knowledge.

title: ë”¥ì—‘ìŠ¤, CES 2026ì„œ â€˜5W ë¯¸ë§Œ ì´ˆì €ì „ë ¥ LLM ì¶”ë¡ â€™ ì „ëµ DX-M2 ë¡œë“œë§µ ê³µê°œ
summary: MediaTek subsidiary Deepak unveiled the DX-M2 AI chip roadmap at CES 2026, delivering 100-billion-parameter large language model inference using under 5 watts of power. The second-generation on-device AI processor aims to decentralize generative AI from data centers to edge devices like robots and industrial equipment.

title: ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿â€ğŸš€TechCabal Daily â€“ Mono joins the Wave
summary: Flutterwave, Africa's largest payments startup, acquired Nigerian open-banking platform Mono in an all-stock deal valued between $25-40 million, with Mono retaining independent operations under its current CEO. The acquisition gives Flutterwave access to real-time financial data and customer cash flow insights, enabling expansion into credit services and account-to-account transfers beyond core payments processing.

summary: Chinese AI startup Xiaoyuan developed an interactive social platform where AI agents facilitate user connections and social interactions through psychological models and visual thinking chains. The platform combines personal AI assistants, user-created digital avatars, and AI-mediated conversations to address Gen Z's need for authentic human connection in an AI-augmented social environment.

title: é»„ä»å‹‹å›åº”H200ä½•æ—¶å”®å¾€ä¸­å›½ï¼šæ­£åŠ å¿«ç”Ÿäº§ï¼Œç­‰å¾…è®¸å¯çš„æœ€ç»ˆç»†èŠ‚æ•²å®š
summary: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang said the company is accelerating H200 chip supply chain production for China and awaiting final regulatory approval details from the U.S. government, with strong market demand driving the expansion.

title: å¾®åˆ›æœºå™¨äººå®Œæˆå…¨çƒé¦–ä¾‹â€œå¤§æ¨¡å‹è‡ªä¸»æ‰‹æœ¯â€åŠ¨ç‰©å®éªŒ
summary: Weiwei Robotics completed the world's first autonomous surgery experiment using large language models on animals, leveraging its MicroGenius multimodal self-supervised AI model. This breakthrough fills a global technology gap and advances AI applications in the medical field across sectors.

title: è°·æ­Œé‡é‡‘æŠ¼æ³¨ä¸­å›½ARä¼ä¸šï¼Œä¸XREALæ·±åŒ–æˆ˜ç•¥åˆä½œ
summary: Google and Chinese AR startup XREAL announced a strategic partnership, making XREAL the exclusive hardware partner for Google's AR efforts and maintaining its four-year lead in global AR glasses market share. The companies will launch their first joint product, Project Aura, this year, with Google potentially completing its investment in XREAL during 2026.

summary: Chaosanjubian Digital Technology, spun off from Huawei's x86 server business unit in 2021, officially launched its IPO guidance process with China Securities as lead underwriter. The Zhengzhou-based company emerged as an independent entity after Huawei divested its server operations.

summary: Universal Music Group and Nvidia announced an AI music creation and research partnership to optimize music discovery methods and enhance artist-fan interactions using AI technology.

title: Arrowhead Raises $3 Mn To Scale Voice AI For BFSI Sales
summary: Bengaluru-based voice AI startup Arrowhead raised $3 million in seed funding led by Stellaris Venture Partners to scale its AI agents that handle sales and service calls for banks, NBFCs, and fintech companies with up to 45% higher conversion rates than humans. The company serves 50+ BFSI clients across lending, insurance, and securities with bots supporting seven Indian regional languages.

summary: Aideol, an AI robotics company, unveiled Bedivere, a guide robot for visually impaired people that won two CES 2026 innovation awards in AI and human safety categories. The robot uses advanced sensors and AI-powered localization to provide autonomous navigation assistance with 5.5kg weight and 3-5 hour battery life.

The model introduces mixture-of-experts architecture and supports 128K token context length for processing long Korean documents.

The funding will support xAI's 5-year GPU leasing plan in Memphis, Tennessee, with monthly burn rates requiring billions in additional capital to reach the company's infrastructure goals.

The AI-powered tool automatically converts user questions into SQL queries and generates visualizations, positioning the company to capture the 75% of enterprise analytics content expected to be AI-generated by 2027.

The report emphasizes how companies should align business strategies with regional policy initiatives to compete effectively for government funding.

summary: Chinese AI chip company Taichu Yuan Wei received national high-tech enterprise certification; Qiang Brain neurotechnology completed 2 billion yuan in funding led by investors including IDG and Huang En-yuan's Huasheng International; and T3 ride-hailing successfully migrated all operations to Tencent Cloud, achieving the largest and most complex cloud migration in the mobility sector with 30% cost optimization.

title: Accenture to acquire Faculty AI for undisclosed sum
summary: Accenture acquired London-based Faculty AI, which provides AI software and safety-focused technical solutions to corporate and government clients, for an undisclosed amount. The deal brings Faculty's 400 staff and its enterprise decision-making platform Faculty Frontier into Accenture's offerings, with Faculty CEO Marc Warner becoming Accenture's CTO.

title: UK AI firm Faculty to be acquired by consulting giant Accenture
summary: Accenture acquired UK AI safety startup Faculty for approximately $1 billion, bringing 400+ staff including CEO Marc Warner as new CTO. Faculty advises OpenAI and Anthropic on AI model safety and provides enterprise AI strategy services.

title: Muskâ€™s xAI raises $20bn in funding round that doubles valuation
summary: Elon Musk's xAI raised $20 billion in funding, doubling its valuation to approximately $40 billion. The capital will accelerate development of xAI's large language models and AI infrastructure.

title: Nvidia steps up H200 chip production for Chinese market, Huang says
summary: Nvidia is increasing production of its H200 AI chips for the Chinese market in response to growing demand, CEO Jensen Huang announced.

title: Accenture buys UK AI start-up Faculty in $1bn deal
summary: Accenture acquired UK AI safety startup Faculty for $1 billion to strengthen its AI services offerings and advisory capabilities for enterprise clients.

title: Chinaâ€™s humanoid robots come out fighting
summary: Chinese humanoid robot companies are gaining momentum with increased investment and commercialization efforts as competition intensifies in the robotics sector.

title: European startups at CES 2026: Brainwave passwords, haptic vision, and exoskeletons
summary: French neurotech startup Yneuro demonstrated brain-based biometric authentication technology at CES 2026 that creates unhackable neural passwords from EEG patterns. Dracula Technologies raised â‚¬30 million to commercialize organic photovoltaic technology harvesting ambient indoor light to power IoT devices without batteries.

title: Nvidia Launches Physical AI Models for Robots
summary: Nvidia launched physical AI models for robotics along with simulation frameworks and edge computing hardware to accelerate robot training and deployment.

title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidiaâ€™s debuts to AMDâ€™s new chips to Razerâ€™s AI oddities
summary: Nvidia unveiled its Rubin computing architecture at CES 2026 to replace Blackwell, featuring speed and storage upgrades for AI workloads, while launching the Alpamayo family of open-source AI models for autonomous vehicles. AMD's keynote highlighted new processors and strategic partnerships with OpenAI and AI researchers to advance AI infrastructure.

title: xAI says it raised $20B in Series E funding
summary: xAI, Elon Musk's AI company behind the Grok chatbot with 600 million monthly active users, raised $20 billion in Series E funding from investors including Valor Equity Partners, Fidelity, and Qatar Investment Authority. The capital will fund data center expansion and Grok model development, though the company faces investigations for generating non-consensual sexual content.

title: Commonwealth Fusion Systems installs reactor magnet, lands deal with Nvidia
summary: Commonwealth Fusion Systems installed the first of 18 magnets for its Sparc fusion reactor demonstration device, with all units expected by summer 2026, targeting grid electricity delivery in the early 2030s. The company partnered with Nvidia and Siemens to develop a digital twin using AI to optimize reactor design before operation.

title: NVIDIA DRIVE AV Software Makes Production Debut in New Mercedes-Benz CLA
summary: Nvidia's DRIVE AV autonomous driving software makes its production debut in the new Mercedes-Benz CLA in 2026, delivering advanced Level 2 driver-assistance features including point-to-point urban navigation and collision avoidance on Nvidia's dual-stack AI architecture. The integration combines end-to-end AI learning with classical safety guardrails to enable vehicles to improve through real-world driving data.

title: VentureSouq leads $2 million seed investment in MilkStraw AI
summary: UAE-based AI startup MilkStraw AI raised $2 million in seed funding led by VentureSouq to scale its cloud infrastructure cost optimization platform used by 100+ startups across fintech and SaaS. The company will expand features including AI-powered natural language interface and automated cloud cost management for businesses.

title: Sector Snapshot: US Semiconductor Startup Funding Hits Record High
summary: U.S. semiconductor startup funding hit a record $6.2 billion in 2025, up 85% year-over-year, driven by AI companies' demand for faster and more efficient processors, with Cerebras Systems raising $1.1 billion and PsiQuantum $1 billion in major late-stage rounds. Globally, semiconductor startup investment reached $12.2 billion in 2025, though still modest compared to the $20 billion Nvidia paid for Groq's assets.

title: Crunchbase Predicts: 15 Companies That Could Go Public In 2026 As The IPO Market Gains Momentum
summary: Crunchbase predicts 15 late-stage private companies across AI, fintech, and defense could go public in 2026 as IPO markets improve, with Databricks (valued at $134 billion with 55% YoY growth), Crusoe Energy Systems, and Cohere identified as likely candidates. AI infrastructure and enterprise software companies dominate the list as public market conditions stabilize.

title: Liquid AI Releases LFM2.5: A Compact AI Model Family For Real On Device Agents
summary: Liquid AI released LFM2.5, a family of compact AI models (1.2B parameters) optimized for on-device and edge deployment with variants for Japanese language, vision, and audio tasks. The models achieve superior performance on reasoning benchmarks (MMLU Pro: 44.35) compared to other 1B-class competitors while maintaining efficiency for CPU and NPU inference.

The integrated system delivers up to 7x faster performance and 8x better energy efficiency compared to CPU-based solutions.

Bosch adopted S32N7 as the first automaker to implement the processor in its integrated platform.

title: Agibot's tiny, portable humanoid
summary: Chinese robotics startup Agibot unveiled Q1, a 31-inch backpack-sized humanoid with crash-proof joints and zero-code programming that teaches English and dances. The company, which built 5,000 robots and operates three mass-produced humanoid lines, highlighted how China's robotics industry is expanding beyond factories into homes.

title: Metaâ€™s AI chief scientist leaves with parting shots
summary: Meta's departing AI chief scientist Yann LeCun criticized CEO Alexander Wang as inexperienced and admitted Llama 4 benchmarks were manipulated, warning of more departures from the company's AI team. LeCun is launching a new AI startup called AMI with French healthcare AI founder Alex LeBrun as CEO, maintaining that LLMs are a dead end for achieving superintelligence.

The company introduced Vision AI Companion for TVs, new display and audio technologies including HDR10+ Advanced and Eclipsa Audio, plus a 130-inch Micro RGB TV.

title: NEWS: Elon Musk has confirmed that xAI has purchased five additional 380MW natural gas turbines, wit...
summary: Elon Musk's xAI purchased five 380MW natural gas turbines to power an additional 600,000+ Nvidia GB200-equivalent GPU cluster, with the first two units scheduled for delivery by end of 2026. The infrastructure expansion supports xAI's AI model training and deployment operations.

title:
The end of an era, Stack Exchange that is.

They finished shutting down the physical server racks th...
summary: Stack Exchange completed its infrastructure migration by decommissioning the physical server racks that powered its Q&A sites for 16 years, moving all operations to cloud hosting with the last New Jersey datacenter hardware removed in December 2025.

title: ChatGPTâ€™s daily web visits slid from roughly 200M down to roughly 158M, which is about a 22% drop ov...
summary: ChatGPT's daily web traffic declined 22% over six weeks to approximately 158 million visitors following Gemini 3's launch, while Gemini remained stable at roughly 60 million visitors, narrowing the gap to 40% of ChatGPT's traffic. The shift suggests potential user migration toward Google's generative AI alternative.

title: NEWS: Boston Dynamics has announced that it will begin manufacturing the new version of its Atlas ro...
summary: Boston Dynamics began manufacturing its new Atlas humanoid robot with 4-hour battery life and -4Â°F to 104Â°F operating range, shipping fleets to Hyundai and Google DeepMind in coming months. Additional customers are expected to receive the autonomous robots in early 2027.

title: Chinaâ€™s Telecom Giants Back Smart-Glasses Maker RayNeo in $143 Million Funding Round
summary: Shenzhen AR smart-glasses maker RayNeo raised over $143 million in funding co-led by China Mobile and CITIC Goldstone, marking major Chinese telecom firms' bet on spatial computing hardware.

title: Nvidia unveils 'reasoning' AI technology for self-driving cars
summary: Nvidia unveiled Alpamayo, an open-source AI reasoning platform for autonomous vehicles that enables self-driving cars to think through complex scenarios and explain decisions, with production beginning on a Mercedes-Benz CLA launching in the US within months. The platform is available on Hugging Face for free, allowing researchers to retrain the model for their autonomous vehicle projects.

title: AMD unveils new AI PC processors for general use and gaming at CES
summary: AMD announced the latest version of its AI-powered PC chips designed for a variety of tasks from gaming to content creation and multitasking.

title: Intel launches Core Ultra Series 3 AI PC platform at CES 2026
summary: Intel unveiled its Core Ultra Series 3 processors (Panther Lake) at CES 2026, built on the Intel 18A manufacturing process and designed to power over 200 PC designs with improved power efficiency, AI capabilities, and up to 50 TOPS of neural processing performance. Consumer laptops featuring Core Ultra Series 3 will begin shipping January 27, with pre-orders starting January 6.

summary: AMD launched the Ryzen AI 400 processor with up to 12 cores and 60 TOPS NPU performance for AI PCs, positioning it 1.3x faster than Intel Core Ultra 288V in multi-tasking and delivering competitive performance against Nvidia's Blackwell in AI workloads through its XDNA 2 architecture.

summary: Upstage released Solar Open 100B, an open-source large language model that outperforms DeepSeek R1 and OpenAI's GPT-OSS-120B across multiple benchmarks, particularly in Korean language tasks where it achieved 2x higher performance on knowledge evaluation benchmarks.

title: Nvidia Details New A.I. Chips and Autonomous Car Project With Mercedes
summary: Nvidia unveiled its new Vera Rubin AI chip, named after the astronomer who discovered dark matter, and announced a partnership with Mercedes-Benz to develop autonomous vehicle technology. The collaboration will leverage Nvidia's latest hardware to accelerate self-driving capabilities in Mercedes vehicles.

title: Japanâ€™s SORA Technology raises $2.5 million to scale health drones in Africa
summary: Japan-based SORA Technology raised $2.5 million in its second close of late-seed funding to scale AI-powered drone solutions for malaria control and disease forecasting across Africa. The funding brings total capital to $7.3 million, with the company already deployed in over 10 African countries and partnered with the WHO for mosquito control initiatives.

title: Trump Orders Chinese-Controlled Firm to Unwind Purchase of U.S. Chip Assets
summary: President Trump ordered a Chinese-controlled company to divest its acquisition of aerospace and defense manufacturer Emcore Corp.'s assets, citing national security concerns over U.S. chip technology.

title: Robot-Maker Unitreeâ€™s IPO Expected by Mid-2026, Source Says
summary: Chinese robotics manufacturer Unitree Robotics is on track for a domestic IPO expected to complete by mid-2026, despite recent media reports suggesting the fast-track approval process was suspended.

title: Antler bags $510M in new funds, half for the US founders, as Airalo and Lovable soar to unicorn
summary: Antler, a company-building platform providing seed investments and mentorship to early-stage founders, closed $510 million in new funding across US, European, and Asian funds, with half allocated to US startups. The platform has backed over 1,800 startups including unicorns Airalo (eSIM technology) and Lovable (AI code generation platform).

title: Ofcom asks X about reports its Grok AI makes sexualised images of children
summary: UK regulator Ofcom made urgent contact with Elon Musk's xAI following reports that Grok, a free AI chatbot on X, can generate sexualized images of children and non-consensual intimate imagery of women. The European Commission, UK authorities, and regulators in France, Malaysia, and India are investigating the matter.

title: Microsoftâ€™s Nadella wants us to stop thinking of AI as â€˜slopâ€™
summary: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella called for reframing AI as a "scaffolding for human potential" and cognitive amplifier tool rather than a replacement for workers or low-quality content. His position contrasts with other AI leaders who have warned the technology could eliminate 50% of entry-level white-collar jobs within five years.

title: Nvidia wants to be the Android of generalist robotics
summary: Nvidia released an open-source robotics ecosystem at CES 2026, including foundation models Cosmos Predict 2.5, Cosmos Reason 2, and Isaac GR00T N1.6, plus Isaac Lab-Arena simulation framework and OSMO command center, positioning itself as the default platform for generalist robots. The models enable robots to reason, plan, and adapt across multiple tasks and environments rather than performing narrow task-specific functions.

title: Nvidia launches powerful new Rubin chip architecture
summary: Nvidia launched its Rubin GPU architecture at CES 2026, featuring a six-chip system designed to handle exponentially growing AI computation demands with improvements in storage and interconnection. The architecture is already in full production and will be deployed by major cloud providers including Anthropic, OpenAI, and AWS, as well as in HPE's Blue Lion supercomputer.

title: Nvidia launches Alpamayo, open AI models that allow autonomous vehicles to â€˜think like a humanâ€™
summary: Nvidia released Alpamayo, an open-source family of AI models and simulation tools enabling autonomous vehicles to reason through complex driving scenarios by breaking problems into steps, similar to human thinking. The 10 billion-parameter model is available on Hugging Face and allows developers to fine-tune it for simpler driving systems or build auto-labeling and evaluation tools.

title: Amazonâ€™s AI assistant comes to the web with Alexa.com
summary: Amazon launched Alexa.com and a revamped Alexa mobile app featuring its AI-powered Alexa+ assistant as a web-based chatbot, expanding beyond 600 million Echo devices globally. The platform enables users to control smart home devices, manage calendars, make reservations, and access integrated services from Angi, Expedia, Square, and Yelp.

title: Google previews new Gemini features for TV at CES 2026
summary: Google previewed new Gemini AI features for Google TV devices at CES 2026, enabling voice-controlled content discovery, photo and video editing with AI, educational deep-dives, and voice-based TV settings adjustments. The features will first roll out to select TCL televisions before broader deployment across other Google TV devices.

title: Manusâ€“Meta Deal May Come Under Scrutiny From Beijing: Report
summary: Meta's acquisition of Singapore-based AI startup Manus faces potential Chinese regulatory scrutiny over technology export controls, as the company was founded in China in 2022 and raised $75 million in Series B funding in April 2025 before relocating headquarters. Chinese regulators may assess whether restricted technologies were transferred abroad without approval under China's tech import-export regulations.

title: Cobalt Credit Union deploys Eltropyâ€™s AI Voice technology
summary: Cobalt Credit Union deployed Eltropy's AI Voice technology to serve military members and families, achieving 83% session containment rate while maintaining high member satisfaction as one of the first credit unions using DNA core systems to implement this AI solution.

title: Tencent Researchers Release Tencent HY-MT1.5: A New Translation Models Featuring 1.8B and 7B Models Designed for Seamless on-Device and Cloud Deployment
summary: Tencent released HY-MT1.5, a multilingual translation model family with 1.8B and 7B variants supporting 33 languages, where the lightweight 1.8B model runs on devices with ~1GB memory at 0.18-second response time while outperforming commercial translation APIs in quality.

title: Africaâ€™s PR costs are soaring; ex-CNN anchor Zain Verjee has an AI fix
summary: Former CNN anchor Zain Verjee launched The Rundown Studio, an AI-powered communications platform offering 12 specialized tools to help African startups and nonprofits reduce PR costs from $1,500-$20,000+ monthly to affordable tiers. The platform provides newsroom-tested frameworks for press releases, media pitches, and TV scripts designed specifically for emerging markets' resource constraints.
